tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE security_incidents (
    incident_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    incident_date DATE,
    incident_type VARCHAR(100),
    description TEXT,
    affected_entities JSON
);

CREATE TABLE SecurityIncidents (
    incident_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    incident_date DATE,
    incident_type VARCHAR(50),
    description TEXT,
    impact VARCHAR(100)
);

CREATE TABLE BreachDetails (
    breach_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    breach_date DATE,
    breach_type VARCHAR(50),
    organization VARCHAR(100),
    data_type VARCHAR(50)
);

CREATE TABLE breach_details (
    breach_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    incident_id INT REFERENCES security_incidents(incident_id),
    breach_date TIMESTAMP,
    breach_type VARCHAR(50),
    affected_records INT
);

CREATE TABLE breach_reports (
    report_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    breach_id INT REFERENCES breach_details(breach_id),
    report_date TIMESTAMP,
    reporter_name VARCHAR(50),
    report_description TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE breach_details (
    breach_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    incident_id INT REFERENCES security_incidents(incident_id),
    breached_system VARCHAR(100),
    breach_date DATE,
    breach_description TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE affected_entities (
    entity_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    incident_id INT REFERENCES security_incidents(incident_id),
    entity_name VARCHAR(100),
    entity_type VARCHAR(50),
    impact_level VARCHAR(50)
);

CREATE TABLE investigation_logs (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    incident_id INT REFERENCES security_incidents(incident_id),
    investigator_name VARCHAR(100),
    log_date DATE,
    log_details TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE incidents (
    incident_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    incident_type TEXT,
    incident_date DATE,
    location TEXT,
    description TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE breach_types (
    breach_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    breach_name TEXT,
    breach_description TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE affected_entities (
    entity_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    entity_name TEXT,
    entity_type TEXT,
    entity_description TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE security_measures (
    measure_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    measure_name TEXT,
    measure_description TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE incident_details (
    detail_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    incident_id INTEGER REFERENCES incidents(incident_id),
    measure_id INTEGER REFERENCES security_measures(measure_id),
    entity_id INTEGER REFERENCES affected_entities(entity_id),
    notes TEXT
)
